actor_awards.notes: Best known for his iconic role as Fred Mertz in the television sitcom 'I Love Lucy' and as Bub O'Casey in 'My Three Sons'. He received five Primetime Emmy nominations for his television work and has a Star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.

filmography.title: Miracle on 34th Street
filmography.role_description: A cynical political advisor who warns Judge Harper about the political consequences of ruling that Santa Claus doesn't exist.
filmography.plot: When a nice old man who claims to be Santa Claus is institutionalized as insane, a young lawyer decides to defend him by arguing in court that he is the real thing.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Supporting Actor (Edmund Gwenn), Best Screenplay, Best Original Story

filmography.title: Monsieur Verdoux
filmography.role_description: The father of one of Verdoux's prospective victims, appearing in the wedding reception sequence.
filmography.plot: A suave but cynical man supports his family by marrying and murdering wealthy women for their money, but the job has some occupational hazards.

filmography.title: Gentleman Jim
filmography.role_description: The boxing manager and trainer who helps James J. Corbett rise to the heavyweight championship.
filmography.plot: The biography of the colorful heavyweight champion James J. Corbett, who rises from bank teller to the top of the boxing world.

filmography.title: Going My Way
filmography.role_description: A music publisher who hears Father O'Malley's song and helps him raise money for the church.
filmography.plot: A young priest arrives at a failing New York parish to take over from an established and aging congregation leader.

filmography.title: The Lemon Drop Kid
filmography.role_description: A grumbling gangster and associate of the main character, known for his pessimistic outlook.
filmography.plot: A con man has to come up with $10,000 for a gangster or he won't make it to Christmas.

filmography.title: Abbott and Costello Meet the Invisible Man
filmography.role_description: A police detective investigating a murder for which a boxer has been framed.
filmography.plot: Two bumbling private eyes help a boxer who has been framed for murder and has turned invisible to clear his name.

filmography.title: Roxie Hart
filmography.role_description: The foreman of the jury in the sensational murder trial of Roxie Hart.
filmography.plot: A dancer confesses to a murder she didn't commit to get publicity for her career, sparking a media circus.

filmography.title: Rancho Notorious
filmography.role_description: An outlaw hiding out at the Chuck-a-Luck ranch who crosses paths with a man seeking revenge.
filmography.plot: A rancher obsessed with revenge for the murder of his fiancée infiltrates a remote outlaw hideout run by a former saloon singer.

filmography.title: Kiss Tomorrow Goodbye
filmography.role_description: A mob boss who gets involved with the ruthless criminal Ralph Cotter.
filmography.plot: A violent criminal escapes from a prison farm and goes on a rampage, manipulating everyone in his path.

filmography.title: Ziegfeld Follies
filmography.role_description: A character in the 'A Sweepstakes Ticket' segment of this musical revue.
filmography.plot: The late Florenz Ziegfeld looks down from heaven and imagines a new revue featuring the greatest MGM stars.
filmography.awards: Cannes Film Festival: Win – Best Musical Comedy

filmography.title: The Babe Ruth Story
filmography.role_description: The manager of the Baltimore Orioles who discovers Babe Ruth.
filmography.plot: A biographical film following the career of baseball legend Babe Ruth, from his time in an orphanage to his rise as a sports icon.

filmography.title: Mother Wore Tights
filmography.role_description: A theater manager in this Technicolor musical about a vaudeville family.
filmography.plot: The story of a vaudeville couple who juggle their careers with raising two daughters.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Music (Scoring of a Musical Picture)

filmography.title: The General Died at Dawn
filmography.role_description: A heavy-drinking American gunrunner involved in Chinese warlord conflicts.
filmography.plot: An American mercenary in China tries to stop a warlord from using arms he sold him to conquer the country.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Cinematography, Best Supporting Actor (Akim Tamiroff)

filmography.title: Lady on a Train
filmography.role_description: A skeptical police sergeant who deals with a woman claiming she witnessed a murder from a train.
filmography.plot: A woman witnesses a murder from a train window and gets involved in solving the crime when the police don't believe her.

filmography.title: High, Wide, and Handsome
filmography.role_description: A roustabout and friend to the protagonist in the early Pennsylvania oil fields.
filmography.plot: In 1859 Pennsylvania, a farmer discovers oil and fights a railroad tycoon who wants to take it.

filmography.title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
filmography.role_description: A con artist who, along with The King, takes over Huck and Jim's raft.
filmography.plot: Huckleberry Finn flees his abusive father and rafts down the Mississippi River with an escaped slave named Jim.

filmography.title: Flame of Barbary Coast
filmography.role_description: A gambler and associate of the main character in San Francisco.
filmography.plot: A Montana cowboy comes to San Francisco and opens a gambling hall to compete with the local boss.

filmography.title: The Bride Came C.O.D.
filmography.role_description: A sheriff who gets involved when a pilot kidnaps an heiress to stop her wedding.
filmography.plot: A pilot agrees to kidnap an oil tycoon's daughter to prevent her from marrying a bandleader.

filmography.title: Footsteps in the Dark
filmography.role_description: A police detective who is constantly one step behind the amateur sleuth protagonist.
filmography.plot: An investment advisor secretly writes mystery novels and tries to solve a real murder case.

filmography.title: One Night in the Tropics
filmography.role_description: A gangster who sells 'love insurance' in this musical comedy.
filmography.plot: An insurance salesman comes up with a policy that pays out if a man doesn't marry his fiancée.

filmography.title: Whistling in Brooklyn
filmography.role_description: A police detective chasing a radio sleuth suspected of being a killer.
filmography.plot: A radio crime solver is mistaken for a killer and must find the real culprit while on the run.

filmography.title: The Fighting O'Flynn
filmography.role_description: The loyal and comical sidekick to the Irish adventurer O'Flynn.
filmography.plot: An Irish adventurer tries to stop Napoleon's agents from invading Ireland.

filmography.title: Rose of Washington Square
filmography.role_description: A booking agent who helps the career of a Ziegfeld Follies singer.
filmography.plot: A singer falls in love with a con artist and stands by him through his troubles.

filmography.title: Safe at Home!
filmography.role_description: The father of a boy who lies about knowing Mickey Mantle and Roger Maris. Frawley's final film role.
filmography.plot: A young boy brags to his Little League team that he knows Mickey Mantle and Roger Maris, then has to produce them.

filmography.title: Something to Sing About
filmography.role_description: A studio publicity man who creates a fake persona for a bandleader turned actor.
filmography.plot: A New York bandleader goes to Hollywood and gets caught up in a publicity stunt that threatens his marriage.
